analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT Honourable, Reuerend, Worshipfull, and Worthy Com∣missioners, appointed by the Kings most Sacred Maiesty, for the Repara∣tion of St. PAVLS Church in LONDON:
analytic.author: Farley, Henry

monogr.title: Portland-stone in Paules-Church-yard : Their birth, their mirth, their thankefulnesse, their aduertisement. Written by Hen: Farley, a free-man of London: who hath done as freely for free-stone, within these eight yeares, as most men, and knowes as much of their mindes as an man. Buy, or goe by
monogr.author: Farley, Henry

div.head: TO THE RIGHT Honourable, Reuerend, Worshipfull, and Worthy Commissioners, appointed by the Kings most Sacred Maiesty, for the Reparation of St. PAVLS Church in LONDON:

opener.salute: My very good Lords and Masters.

div.l: IF your graue Wisedomes herein I offend.
And hath respect to God, King, Church and You.
In all humilitie shee's well content,
For her least fault to be right penitent;
And (of your fauors) craues but this for guerdon,
If well, your boon; if ill, your gentle pardon.

closer.signed: Amore, Veritate, & Reuerentia. So deuoted to Gods House, And to your Lordships and Worships euer bounden, HEN: FARLEY.
